title: Seafood Okonomiyaki
description: A traditional Japanese savory pancake dish with seafood
directions: Defrost froze seafood in a salt water in a bowl.
In a large bowl, mix and whisk the flour, water and dashi well. Add the eggs and mix well
Chop cabbage into small pieces and add to the bowl.
Drain the salt water and add the seafood to the large bowl and mix well.
Pour 1 meal portion into a heated pan (about 3 scoops with a small scoop) and cook for 3 min
Flip the pancake, cover with a lid and cook for 3 min.
Serve on plate and pour okonomi sauce, Japanese mayo, seaweed flakes or any sauce of your choie

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: A flavorful Indian curry dish with marinated chicken in a creamy tomato sauce.
ingredients: 800g boneless chicken thighs, cut into chunks
directions: In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, half the garlic, half the ginger, and half of each spice. Add chicken and marinate for at least 1 hour, preferably overnight.
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add remaining garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add remaining spices, stir for 30 seconds.
Add tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat grill or broiler. Thread chicken onto skewers and grill/broil until charred and cooked through, about 8 minutes per side.
Add grilled chicken to the sauce, then stir in cream. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Adjust salt to taste and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve with rice or naan bread.

title: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg
description: A simple, nutritious breakfast that's ready in minutes.
directions: Toast the bread until golden and crispy.
While bread is toasting, bring a pot of water to a gentle simmer. Add white vinegar.
Crack the egg into a small cup. Create a gentle whirlpool in the simmering water and carefully slide the egg in. Cook for 3 minutes for a runny yolk.
Scoop out the poached egg with a slotted spoon and place on a paper towel.
Mash the avocado in a bowl with salt and pepper.
Spread the mashed avocado on the toast, top with the poached egg.
Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with red pepper flakes if using, and garnish with microgreens.
Serve immediately.

title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Soft and chewy cookies with melty chocolate chips, perfect for any occasion.
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, beat butter and both sugars until creamy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla.
Gradually add flour mixture until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart.
Bake for 9-12 minutes or until edges are golden but centers are still soft.
Let cookies cool on baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
